etymologies: Old English (for)stoppian ‘block up (an aperture)’, of West Germanic origin; related to German stopfen, from late Latin stuppare ‘to stuff’

definitions: (of an event, action, or process) come to an end; cease to happen

examples.text: his laughter stopped as quickly as it had begun
the rain had stopped and the clouds had cleared

shortDefinitions: come to end

definitions: cease to perform a specified action or have a specified experience

examples.text: she stopped giggling
he stopped work for tea

shortDefinitions: cease to perform specified action or have specified experience

definitions: abandon a specified practice or habit

examples.text: I've stopped eating meat

shortDefinitions: abandon specified practice or habit

definitions: stop moving or operating

examples.text: he stopped to look at the view
my watch has stopped

shortDefinitions: stop moving or operating

definitions: (of a bus or train) call at a designated place to pick up or let off passengers

examples.text: main-line trains stop at platform 7

shortDefinitions: call at designated place to pick up or set down passengers

definitions: stay somewhere for a short time

examples.text: you'll have to stop the night

shortDefinitions: stay somewhere for short time

definitions: cause (an action, process, or event) to come to an end

examples.text: this harassment has got to be stopped

shortDefinitions: cause action, process, or event to come to end

definitions: prevent (an action or event) from happening

examples.text: a security guard was killed trying to stop a raid

shortDefinitions: prevent action or event from happening

definitions: prevent or dissuade (someone) from continuing in an activity or achieving an aim

examples.text: a campaign is under way to stop the bombers

shortDefinitions: prevent or dissuade someone from continuing in activity or achieving aim

definitions: prevent (someone or something) from performing a specified action or undergoing a specified experience

examples.text: you can't stop me from getting what I want

shortDefinitions: prevent person or thing from performing specified action

definitions: cause or order to cease moving or operating

examples.text: he stopped his car by the house
police were given powers to stop and search suspects

shortDefinitions: cause or order to cease moving or operating

definitions: be hit by (a bullet).
shortDefinitions: be hit by

definitions: instruct a bank to withhold payment on (a check)

examples.text: he grew nervous about the deal and asked his bank manager to stop the check

shortDefinitions: instruct bank to withhold payment on

definitions: refuse to supply as usual; withhold or deduct

examples.text: the union has threatened to stop the supply of minerals

shortDefinitions: refuse to supply as usual

definitions: defeat (an opponent) by a knockout

examples.text: he was stopped in the sixth by Tyson

shortDefinitions: defeat opponent by knockout

definitions: block or close up (a hole or leak)

examples.text: he tried to stop the hole with the heel of his boot
the drain has been stopped up

shortDefinitions: block or close up

definitions: block the mouth of (a fox's earth) prior to a hunt.
shortDefinitions: block mouth of fox's earth prior to hunt

definitions: plug the upper end of (an organ pipe), giving a note an octave lower.
shortDefinitions: plug upper end of organ pipe

definitions: obtain the required pitch from (the string of a violin or similar instrument) by pressing at the appropriate point with the finger.
shortDefinitions: obtain required pitch from by pressing at appropriate point with finger

definitions: make (a rope) fast with a stopper.
shortDefinitions: make rope fast with stopper

definitions: a cessation of movement or operation

examples.text: all business came to a stop
there were constant stops and changes of pace

shortDefinitions: cessation of movement or operation

definitions: a break or halt during a journey

examples.text: allow an hour or so for driving and as long as you like for stops
the flight landed for a refueling stop

shortDefinitions: break or halt during journey

definitions: a place designated for a bus or train to halt and pick up or drop off passengers

examples.text: the bus was pulling up at her stop

shortDefinitions: place designated for bus or train to halt and pick up or set down passengers

definitions: an object or part of a mechanism which is used to prevent something from moving

examples.text: the shelves have special stops to prevent them from being pulled out too far

shortDefinitions: object or part of mechanism which is used to prevent something from moving

definitions: a punctuation mark, especially a period.
shortDefinitions: punctuation mark

definitions: used in telegrams to indicate a period

examples.text: MEET YOU AT THE AIRPORT STOP

shortDefinitions: used in telegrams to indicate full stop

definitions: a consonant produced with complete closure of the vocal tract

examples.text: a bilabial stop
stop consonants

shortDefinitions: consonant produced with complete closure of vocal tract

definitions: a high card that prevents the opponents from establishing a particular suit; a control

examples.text: if West bids 3♥ now, this will show a heart stop

shortDefinitions: high card that prevents opponents from establishing particular suit

definitions: a short length of cord used to secure something.
shortDefinitions: short length of rope used to secure something

definitions: a set of organ pipes of a particular tone and range of pitch.
shortDefinitions: set of organ pipes of particular tone and range of pitch

definitions: a knob, lever, or similar device in an organ or harpsichord which brings into play a set of pipes or strings of a particular tone and range of pitch.
shortDefinitions: knob, lever, or similar device

definitions: the effective diameter of a lens.
shortDefinitions: effective diameter of lens

definitions: a device for reducing the effective diameter of a lens.
shortDefinitions: device for reducing effective diameter of lens

definitions: a unit of change of relative aperture or exposure (with a reduction of one stop equivalent to halving it).
shortDefinitions: unit of change of relative aperture or exposure
